metadata.title: USN-6983-1 -- FFmpeg vulnerability
metadata.description: Zeng Yunxiang discovered that FFmpeg incorrectly handled memory during video encoding. An attacker could possibly use this issue to perform a denial of service, or execute arbitrary code.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6983-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  ffmpeg - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 ffmpeg-doc - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavcodec-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavcodec-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavcodec58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavdevice-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavdevice58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavfilter-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavfilter-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavfilter7 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavformat-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavformat-extra - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavformat-extra58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavformat58 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavutil-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libavutil56 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libpostproc-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libpostproc55 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libswresample-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libswresample3 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libswscale-dev - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 libswscale5 - 7:4.4.2-0ubuntu0.22.04.1+esm5 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
